title: Add React Compiler ESLint rules for silent failure detection
description:
Configure `eslint-plugin-react-hooks` to surface React Compiler silent failures as errors.

**Source**: https://acusti.ca/blog/2025/12/16/react-compiler-silent-failures-and-how-to-fix-them

**Problem**: React Compiler fails silently when it encounters patterns it cannot optimize. The compiler exists to make code work better, not to make it work at all - when compilation fails silently, performance degrades without visibility.

**Rules to Enable as Errors**:
1. `react-hooks/todo` - Detects unsupported compiler patterns that the compiler cannot yet optimize
2. `react-hooks/unsupported-syntax` - Catches invalid syntax (change from warn to error)

**Additional Rules Provided by react-hooks plugin**:
- `react-hooks/capitalized-calls` - Prevents calling capitalized functions instead of JSX
- `react-hooks/hooks` - Reimplements rules-of-hooks validation
- `react-hooks/rule-suppression` - Validates suppression usage
- `react-hooks/syntax` - Catches invalid syntax

**Common Patterns These Rules Catch**:
- Destructuring and mutation: `function MyComponent({ value }) { value = value ?? someStateValue; }` - should use new variable
- Complex try/catch: Conditional logic, ternaries, optional chaining within try/catch blocks prevent compilation
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] react-hooks/todo rule added as error in eslint.js
- [ ] react-hooks/unsupported-syntax rule added as error in eslint.js
- [ ] Same rules added to eslint.styled.js (if applicable)
- [ ] Build passes
- [ ] Documentation notes these rules surface React Compiler failures
close_reason: Added 6 React Compiler detection rules to eslint.ts: todo, capitalized-calls, hooks, rule-suppression, syntax, unsupported-syntax. Build and lint pass.

title: Add eslint-plugin-depend
description:
Add `eslint-plugin-depend` to the ESLint config.

**Source**: https://github.com/es-tooling/eslint-plugin-depend (470 stars)

**Purpose**: Helps optimize dependency choices by:
- Detecting redundant polyfills and packages superseded by native functionality
- Flagging microutilities (single-line utility packages)
- Suggesting better-maintained or lighter alternatives
- Reducing dependency tree bloat

**Main Rule**: `depend/ban-dependencies`
- Works on both code imports/requires AND package.json dependencies

**Presets Available**:
1. `native` - Blocks packages redundant with Node.js built-ins (respects engines.node version)
2. `microutilities` - Eliminates single-line utility packages
3. `preferred` - Suggests better alternatives from module-replacements database

title: Add eslint-plugin-react-you-might-not-need-an-effect
description:
Add `eslint-plugin-react-you-might-not-need-an-effect` to the ESLint config.

**Source**: https://github.com/NickvanDyke/eslint-plugin-react-you-might-not-need-an-effect (~1.5k stars)

**Purpose**: Identifies unnecessary `useEffect` hooks by detecting anti-patterns where effects are used when simpler React patterns would suffice. Follows React's "You Might Not Need an Effect" guide.

**10 Rules Provided**:
1. `no-derived-state` - Prevent storing derived state from props/state in effects (compute during render or use useMemo)
2. `no-chain-state-updates` - Disallow chaining state modifications in effects (update simultaneously)
3. `no-event-handler` - Prevent using effects as event handlers (call event logic directly)
4. `no-adjust-state-on-prop-change` - Disallow adjusting state when props change (adjust during render)
5. `no-reset-all-state-on-prop-change` - Prevent resetting all state on prop change (use key prop)
6. `no-pass-live-state-to-parent` - Disallow passing live state to parents via effects (lift state up)
7. `no-pass-data-to-parent` - Prevent passing fetched data to parents in effects (let parent fetch)
8. `no-pass-ref-to-parent` - Disallow passing refs via effects (use forwardRef)
9. `no-initialize-state` - Prevent initializing state in effects (initialize useState directly)
10. `no-empty-effect` - Flag empty effects
design:
**Installation**: `pnpm add -D eslint-plugin-react-you-might-not-need-an-effect`

**Configuration** (Flat Config):
```javascript
import reactYouMightNotNeedAnEffect from "eslint-plugin-react-you-might-not-need-an-effect";

export default [
  reactYouMightNotNeedAnEffect.configs.recommended
];
```

**Integration Steps**:
1. Add `eslint-plugin-react-you-might-not-need-an-effect` to peerDependencies in package.json
2. Import and include in `eslint.js` and `eslint.styled.js` exports
3. Use recommended preset: `reactYouMightNotNeedAnEffect.configs.recommended`
4. Add version replacement in rollup.config.ts for bundling
5. Document companion rules: works best with `react-hooks/exhaustive-deps` and `typescript-eslint/no-floating-promises`
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Plugin added to peerDependencies
- [ ] Plugin integrated into eslint.js
- [ ] Plugin integrated into eslint.styled.js (if applicable for React)
- [ ] Version replacement added to rollup.config.ts
- [ ] Build passes
- [ ] README updated with new rule documentation
close_reason: Added eslint-plugin-react-you-might-not-need-an-effect to dependencies and configured in src/eslint.ts with all 10 rules enabled as warnings for React projects
